title: COVID-19 Vaccines | Middlesex County NJ
cleaned_text: Middlesex County NJ Vaccines Getting vaccinated in Middlesex County is now easier and more convenient than ever! Middlesex County-Operated Vaccination Sites Middlesex County, in partnership with the New Jersey Department of Health, is operating vaccination clinics in several locations for those who live, work or go to school in Middlesex County only. No appointments necessary, walk-ins are welcome. Call for vaccine availability. When to get a vaccine: Everyone 6 months and older are now eligible to receive a COVID-19 bivalent booster vaccine. Eligibility for second bivalent: Those over 65 can receive the bivalent vaccine as long as it's been 4 months since the last Covid vaccine. Immunocompromised can receive the second bivalent as long as it's been two months since the last Covid vaccine. For more information about the eligibility view the [CDC guidelines](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cdc.gov%2fvaccines%2fcovid-19%2fclinical-considerations%2finterim-considerations-us.html%23%3a%7e%3atext%3dBivalent%2520mRNA%2520vaccines%26text%3dmRNA%2520vaccine%2520doses-%2cPeople%2520ages%25206%2520years%2520and%2520older%2520who%2520are%2520unvaccinated%2520or%2cadditional%2520bivalent%2520mRNA%2520vaccine%2520dose&____isexternal=true). [COVID-19 Vaccination Schedules (cdc.gov)](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cdc.gov%2fvaccines%2fcovid-19%2fdownloads%2fCOVID-19-immunization-schedule-ages-6months-older.pdf&____isexternal=true) The recommendation by the federal Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) follows the recommendation from its Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices and the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) Emergency Use Authorization of the Pfizer and the Moderna bivalent boosters. Middlesex County Vaccine Clinics [Date/Time](/government/departments/department-of-public-safety-and-health/covid-19/covid-19-vaccines/-sortn-EDate/-sortd-asc) Vaccine currently administering the [Pfizer vaccine](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cdc.gov%2fvaccines%2fcovid-19%2finfo-by-product%2fpfizer%2findex.html&____isexternal=true) and [Moderna vaccine](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fwww.cdc.gov%2fvaccines%2fcovid-19%2finfo-by-product%2fmoderna%2findex.html&____isexternal=true). Six months or over are eligible for a Covid-19 Vaccine For more information about vaccines, view the [NJ State Vaccination FAQs. ](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fwww.state.nj.us%2fhealth%2fcd%2fdocuments%2ftopics%2fNCOV%2fPublic_FAQ.pdf&____isexternal=true) Vaccination days and locations will vary on a weekly basis and are strictly dependent on vaccine availability. [Did you lose your vaccination card?](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fcovid19.nj.gov%2ffaqs%2fnj-information%2fslowing-the-spread%2fi-lost-my-covid-19-vaccination-card.-how-do-i-get-a-new-copy&____isexternal=true) Other Vaccination Sites Vaccinations are being offered at locations around the state including at pharmacies, healthcare offices, hospitals, and more. [Click here for an interactive map ](https://www.middlesexcountynj.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2fmiddlesexcounty.maps.arcgis.com%2fapps%2fwebappviewer%2findex.html%3fid%3d5ee3b9c98b42435cb2e36246b16997b0&____isexternal=true)showing all vaccination sites in the County. | | Important Message to Residents Everyone Six months or older who lives, works, or studies in Middlesex County, NJ is now eligible for a Covid-19 Vaccine Vaccines are available to all County residents regardless of immigration or insurance status. It is FREE, no I.D. is required, and it's strictly confidential. Your personal information is safe, private and protected by the law through the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and will only be used to maintain your health records. No insurance is necessary, the County will not ask for copayment or coinsurance, this is a completely free service funded by the Board of County Commissioners. At our County facilities, you will be asked to bring proof of identity that can either be a utility bill or another official mail in your name to verify who you are. You do not need a driver's license or passport, if you do not have them. If you have any questions or concerns, please call 732-745-3100. Looking for more information? Find Government Information, Resources, Activities, Assistance, and more on [middlesexcountynj.gov/covid19](https://discovermiddlesex.com/covid19/). Have a COVID-19 question? You can call 732-745-3100. The Call Center hours are as follows: - Monday - Friday, 9:30 am - 4:30 pm. - Closed on weekends and holidays.
